page.title: 08CHILDREN'S GAMES
page.content: Variations on chasing or hide-and- seek, with each side taking the characters of heroes or villains are always popular, as is 'messing about' with a ball. Girls play with skipping ropes and all enjoy using climbing apparatus, slides and swings. 'Camps' can be made in trees or bushes. Younger children love sand and water. Hop-scotch, marbles, fives and conkers are all annual crazes while roller skating and Yo-yo twirling have been popular recently. Many children play in school teams at Football, Hockey, Cricket, Rugby, Netball, Basketball, Running, Tennis, Squash, Table-Tennis and Chess. Indoors there are pastimes such as model-making, painting and, for girls, sewing and knitting. Construction sets keep mainly boys occupied while all play computer and board games.
